author.bio: Mike “Demo” Demopoulos is a longtime lover of open source software. He currently works at BoldGrid (a WordPress site builder) as an evangelist and education liaison. He has spoken at numerous open source events around the world. Mike is a contributor to the Huffington Post as well as other publications. He also volunteers as treasurer for the Joomla project.

wordpressPost.title: Meet BoldGrid, WPCampus 2018 Sponsor

wordpressPost.content:
This post is part of a series featuring sponsors from our WPCampus 2018 conference. Events like WPCampus would not be possible without the support of these amazing organizations. Be sure to check out their services and say hi to them in St. Louis.

BoldGrid is pleased to announce the sponsorship of the 2018 WPCampus conference. As a partner in supporting higher education and WordPress, BoldGrid is continuing their commitment to helping the higher education community in reaching their audiences and improving their online presence.

With its easy-to-use, tightly integrated ecosystem of plugins and themes, BoldGrid extends the functionality of WordPress while simplifying the workflow. The BoldGrid WordPress website builder has everything both beginners and experts need to easily build and manage beautiful and professional websites.

BoldGrid wants to see each designer and developer pursue higher education and be successful at building powerful websites. This is why over 35,000 individuals and organizations have trusted BoldGrid as their website solution.

Learn more about BoldGrid

WPCampus 2018 will take place July 12-14, 2018 on the campus of Washington University in St. Louis, Missouri. We hope you can join us for three days filled with sessions, workshops, networking, and social events, all focused on using WordPress in higher education.
